qas.question: What has been the primary purpose of wood for millennia other than fuel?
What is often made of wood that provides shelter to people?
For clues about the climate of a place, we can look at variation in isotopic abundances or what other thing?
What could be made out of wood that could be used to fight off attackers?
What category of items often constructed from wood does a chair belong to?

context: People have used wood for millennia for many purposes, primarily as a fuel or as a <a0_0>construction material<a0_0/> for making <a1_0>houses<a1_0/>, tools, <a3_0>weapons<a3_0/>, <a4_0>furniture<a4_0/>, packaging, artworks, and paper. The year-to-year variation in <a2_0>tree-ring widths<a2_0/> and isotopic abundances gives clues to the prevailing climate at that time.
